page.title: 10Rambling in Coddenham
page.content: Coddenham and Hemingstone have a wealth of paths indicated on Ordnance Survey Maps. Unfortunately, some are almost impassable, especially during summer. Only a minority of landowners maintain the rights of way. However, things could change as there is a growing interest within the local community and the authorities, to improve rambling in the area. One example is the development of the Gipping Valley Walk from Stowmarket to Ipswich which skirts our area. The Suffolk County Council, Babergh and Mid-Suffolk District Councils with help from the countryside Commission and the Manpower Services Commission, are to plan circular walks along the route, two of which occur in our area. These will be well maintained and waymarked.
